messages.messageBody:
1/12/03 03:20:

> Once, my 5dd saw an open mouthed kiss between
> a couple. She asked, "Mom, are they really kissing with their mouths
> open?" I told her yes they were. She replied, "Don't they know they can
> get germs that way?"
> No more explaining was needed. She just thought they should know better.

My 6 year old son asked questions about that sort of kissing once. I tried
to give him a short, simple answer that people who love each other the way a
Mommy and a Daddy do sometimes kiss that way. He asked questions, wanted
details (about tongues), and wanted to try. I'll answer questions, but I'm
NOT going to show my son how to kiss!!!!! Sheesh!

Anyway, a couple weeks ago, before my husband left town, we were kissing.
And Tim watched us carefully, and when we quit, asked if we take so long
kissing because we can't get our tongues to touch at the right angle?

I at least know that my husband left with a smile on his face!! <bwg>

brenda
